intro: Thlaspi sarmatica, commonly known as Sarmatian cress, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters, and it produces small, round seed pods. Thlaspi sarmatica is often found in alpine and steppe regions, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
